Huck learned a lot from life while spending time with Jim on the raft. However, when he sees back his old buddy, what would they do but play and Jim is again in the background almost forgotten. 'Tis a children's adventure book with some great (understatement) lessons.

An adventure story with a social message. Huck is conditioned to be severely racist but his lack of social graces and natural kindness makes it impossible for him to act on his prejudices. Some very lyrical passages; the writing is always vivid and although Finn rings true as a boy, the message he carries is completely adult.
